form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Wyden (for himself and Mr. Merkley) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs

form.official-title: To provide for the addition of certain real property to the reservation of the Siletz Tribe in the State of Oregon.

section.header: Treatment of certain property of the Siletz tribe of the State of Oregon
section.text: Section 7 of the Siletz Tribe Indian Restoration Act (25 U.S.C. 711e) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: The Secretary may accept title to any additional number of acres of real property located within the boundaries of the original 1855 Siletz Coast Reservation established by Executive Order dated November 9, 1855, comprised of land within the political boundaries of Benton, Douglas, Lane, Lincoln, Tillamook, and Yamhill Counties in the State of Oregon, if that real property is conveyed or otherwise transferred to the United States by or on behalf of the tribe.
Land to which title is accepted by the Secretary under this paragraph shall be held in trust by the United States for the benefit of the tribe.

paragraph.text: All real property that is taken into trust under paragraph (1) shallâ€”

subparagraph.text: be considered and evaluated as an on-reservation acquisition under part 151.10 of title 25, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations); and
become part of the reservation of the tribe.

paragraph.text:
Any real property taken into trust under paragraph (1) shall not be eligible, or used, for any gaming activity carried out under the
Indian Gaming Regulatory Act (25 U.S.C. 2701 et seq.).
